sect1.title: Quick install
sect1.para: In short installation in most cases should be very simple:

listitem.para: As a prerequisite you will need to have PyMol installed. Get the free version (0.99) here
Unzip it into a new directory, this is where CMView will be installed

Copy the cmview.cfg to your home directory (in Windows this will be something like c:\Documents and Settings\yourusername). Then edit it to set the path to your pymol executable in the PYMOL_EXECUTABLE line. You MUST use forward slashes for the path and no quotes, e.g.: PYMOL_EXECUTABLE=c:/Program Files/PyMol/pymol.exe
You are done! To run it do:
In linux: just run the cmview shell script
In Windows: double click on cmview.bat
In Mac: double click on CMView.jar

sect1.title: The details
sect1.para: The CMView application itself is just a single java archive file (jar file): CMView.jar. There is a number of external library dependencies that for convenience we include in the downloadable zip file. These are:

listitem.para: From Apache commons: commons-codec-1.3.jar, ws-commons-util-1.0.1.jar, xmlrpc-client-3.0.jar, xmlrpc-common-3.0.jar
From the JUNG project: collections-generic-4.01.jar, jung-api-2.0-alpha2.jar, jung-graph-impl-2.0-alpha2.jar

sect1.para: All of the jar dependencies must be placed in a “jars” directory under the directory where CMView.jar is located.
What the shell/batch scripts do is just running the jar with:

We set the JVM memory to 256MB as the contact map generation requires quite a lot of memory. For very big protein chains (>400 aminoacids) using the ALL atom model you will need even more: set it to 512MB to be on the safe side.

By default CMView will get the secondary structure annotation from the PDB file if present. For getting a more consistent secondary structure annotation and to have it in those cases when is missing in the pdb file, CMView can use the external program DSSP to assign secondary structure. You can download DSSP here, once installed locally you will have to point the config file to the executable.
There are other configurable parameters that can be set in the config file. Please refer to the user's manual for a full description.
